column5: My avatar is my current pb Pike...37 inches from a back lake in the Temagami region...came from the first day I ever sight fished for them...very cool.  Favourite pike lure is still a #5 or 7 Mepps aglia, and occasionally I'll toss bigger stuff, like buchertails.  Also have a nice big green inline spinner with willow leaf blades that I put a white grub on...seems to work quite well. The sight fishing was totally different though...tossing minnow baits and just twitching them on bottom until the fish came over and grabbed 'em.  Oh, and my set-up is a 7 (maybe 7'6) MH Bass Pro shops rod, with a Shimano Corsair spooled with 65 lb. Power Pro.
One of mine from a few years ago. 5 FOW, on a dead smelt, plain hook-and-sinker, black nylon line. West of Timmins.
jocko that looks like a pic from the 80s haha!
im pretty sure it is.

And your point is....?  Actually no, it's not that far back. Good memories, though. We used to have a crew of guys (8-12) from our gun club who rented a cottage for an ice-fishing weekend every winter and we had some dandy catches. This was one of the biggest.  I'm wondering what you keyed in on... the boots? Hey I still wear those boots even now!  It's a scan of a photograph. There was a pre-digital era, ya know, not that long ago!  This one goes a little further back... guess the year...    Sorry, no pike.
pre digital? whats that ? lol uhmmmm Id say 1958-1963
That's my exact rig.  My PB is also a 47.5" Musky.
Not bad, Canucker. Warm.

haha you put a "few" years back i say that was quite a few years back but nice fish indeed, one to remember! also my mom has a pair of boots like the exact same from back then and still wears them haha, the whole get up is just screaming the 80s!

At my age, "a few years back" is a euphemism.  But the picture was actually taken in the 90's. (Early 90's granted) That was one of my most memorable outings... that's why I dug back in the "archives". It was so warm that day that by sunset the bottom had gone out of the snow and we had a hard time getting back down the lake (7 miles) to the lodge. There was a foot of slush, topped by a foot of wet snow.  The whole get-up? Blue jeans, hooded sweatshirt, checkered flannelette shirt, ball cap. I still dress that way when fishing or hunting! Are you saying I'm old-fashioned?
Thoese arent just any boots.....those are Sorels if im not mistaken very nice
lol i had sorels in the early 90s too.....but I WAS 5 YEARS OLD!
Hey, Sorels are good boots. Don't they still make them?  Sorry the thread got hijacked.  Back to the pike? .............

I like this thread  Here my only fish over 40 inches from Toronto islands...    These ones are from Little Vermilion Lake, about 6 hours north of Thunderbay Ontario. They were caught toward the end of May, start of June. All over these were well over 40, the biggest were over 45 inches. I use 50-65lb braided lien with 80lb fluro leaders for pike. Although you'll see some of these were caught while walleye fishing with 20lb braid...  2005            2007 - these three were all on the same lure - that I made myself!    Caught this one about 2 minutes after the one above...
nice thread my PB was 44 inches, 22lbs

My buddy boated this pike when I took him fishing. It was his first time pike fishing. He preferes those silver fish.   Heres a picture of my old man with a beauty   Another good one by the old man.   An old picture from years ago
these are my best 2 but I only fish the inner bay in longpoint for pike the outter bay holds much bigger pike
so beast...I love the skinny 40 inchers.
is that Mill Lake?
...more keep it going

I want to see everything pike related in here.Lets see your PB pics,hear about the fight, share your favorite set ups and lures for pike,favorite spots, methods and strategies, cleaning,preparing and recipes. Show your spoons,spinners,cranks,jerks and swimbaits you have used and methods of retrieve along with the conditions. Anything pike related in this community really...Questions and advice encouraged.

I thought some good Pike angler would of posted by now so what the heck i'll start it off with 2 small pike.  2008 3lb 8oz Northern  2009 3lb 4oz Northern   Same lake, same place, same time frame. Both were caught on 12lb mono and without a leader.  There, now I want to see some BIG NORTHER'S!!!  MTBF

I'll post pics from my best day this year.  Went out for an afternoon with my girlfriend and my dad.  We waited out the rain in the morning and got out around noon.  Best day of pike fishing I've had in Southern Ontario.  Fish caught on jerkbaits mostly.                      Can't ask for much better than that

oh my god... that was one outing? I never caught even seen pike like that in my life and people can go and catch like 10 in an afternoon...That is insane. I'm so damn jealous. You must teach me sensei.
Pike slime smells

theres the only pic i can seem to upload! all my pics are off the digi cam and all are to large to upload and im to computer stupid to figure out how to resize them! caught on a #10 x-rap silver with 8lb test and a steel leader. x-raps and storm thundersticks are money for pike, dont forget long steel leaders

We caught a wack of pike last week...20 or 30 anyway. All trolling 3 to 5' of water with 4" gold and silver williams wablers. We could see the fish (40 inchers) swimming as we were trolling for them. (something to be said for a 4 stroke maybe)...I got tired of catching weeds so I went shallow. 50' back and 6" down. I could see the lure and the pike were coming up and smashing it.
Damn!, we should be friends lol.

dara run a #10 x-rap, you will catch 50-60 pike not just a tiny 20-30pike. i've caught over 60pike in one day on one x-rap, had to change the hooks twice that day cause they were bent out of whack and snapping off. went the weekend after and got 50 pike and no can't tell you the lake on here. pm me and i'll guide you in the right direction! all nice sizes to and from cold water! also theres zero weeds in this lake, no grass mowing!
These were about the size of the ones in the pics at the top of the page. I'm not a real big Pike guy. I was just out with some American friends for the week. meat hunters they were

Here's my PB, the picture doesn't do it justice, note the 6'6 bass rod  It was 38 inches and 13 pounds Caught it last summer, in probably 20-25 feet of water slow rolling a big spinnerbait  I also caught this "Silver Pike" this spring, I thought it was really cool.    -Ben
My PB  48 inches 28-32 lbs
my BP would be the one that's in my signature.  Just under 40".   Ahh pike slime, its like fishing aftershave.
i like pike..
Here's a few.....        This was my buddies fish
Monsters..everywhere...I'm hoping to catch those soon enough. Are all these pics like super far undisturbed lakes? fly ins? not even?

I have small shallow lake close to the cottage, we portage in there once or twice a year in the Spring! There is a abundance of Pike in there a whole lot of hammerhandles but a few in the 30's.  If you go in June or later hard to get anything.  This year when we went, my one buddy throws a Chartuese Mepps # 5 and I a black orange, he contunally catches fish I try a pile of others and nothing works, even others chartuese ones.  He out fishes like 25 to 5 on the day?? I now have a few of those in the box!! Happy fishing
not mine.  i fish within 3 or less hrs of toronto  biggest fish are caught through the ice, early in the spring or late in the fall.
Or, 3 seconds in Downtown T.O. after you step off the bus like this loogan:

Grant you're such a charmer..  Where's your club 40 pics??  Oh wait!!  We're still waiting for you dues..   If you're at the right place at the right time, you could even tie into one of these beauties..            cheers HD
I don't fish for them much, but this was my biggest up on Georgian Bay, 38 inches.... And my crazy boat hair.
Here's my PB a FAT 40 incher.....missed an even bigger one that night....and seen 2 more bigger than that fish....that one was the only one landed...but fun night for sure!
thats huge. what test line you guys use for 30 inchers+?

Have not fished pike seriously for years but use to fish around Toronto a lot in the spring. Used a boat and trolled deep diving rapalas slowly with good results. Was named 'Pike angler of the year' for a couple of years by Canadian Sportfishing after a couple of trips down to Toronto Harbour in each late March some years ago. Days of a couple of dozen fish in the 35-43 inch range were happening then. Now i rarely fish.  All the same day     buddy caught first fish of day before the sun broke out and fish really started slammin'
I use a 6'6" medium action rod with 10 lb fireline crystal for every fish I catch. Biggest I caught on it was a 47" musky.
